name: Pair
description: Perfect for a pair of improvisers. That's two, if you're not great at words.

name: Three
description: Three is the number of people who can play this game, and the number of players shall be "three."

name: Any
description: It really doesn't matter how many people you have. Player count not important only life important.

name: At least Two
description: They say one is the loneliest number. I agree, because hey - one isn't even enough to play this game.

name: More than 2
description: You'll need more than two to tango for this one.

name: 2 and 2
description: Two players are in this game. Oh yeah, also there are two other players in this game. I guess that makes four, but they're sort of in teams.

name: 3 or 4
description: You can use three players, or your can use four. It's your choice - but beware! You could . . . eh, nothing bad will happen. It doesn't really matter.

name: Two Teams of 3
description: It's like Gus Macker, except it's less dumb because it isn't basketball. I would apologize for offending you, but if you like basketball you probably didn't notice anyway.

name: Two teams of at least Two
description: All that matters is that you have two even teams here. How big the teams are is up to you, but maybe you should take it easy, yeah?

name: At least 2 plus 1
description: Some would just say three, but I'm not one of those.

name: Four
description: A game with four players in it! Not one or two or three but four! Four players!

name: Five
description: All of the best teams have five people. The Beatles, Monty Python, The Marx Brothers, the list goes on and on. What do you mean none of those had five people?

name: Probably at least 8
description: This will require a good, sizable group to work well, so you'll have to make some more friends. Jeez, it's just like high school all over again.

name: Three plus One
description: My grandma always said you should never have an odd number of boys in a room together. Always have a referee.

name: Four plus One
description: Four people play this game. Also another person plays this game, but in a different capacity. It's like a barbershop quartet with some annoying tone-deaf dude that always follows them around.

name: One or Two
description: If somebody on your team is really stinky or something you can make them do this by themsevles.

name: Four to Twelve
description: It takes a village to raise a child. I guess this game is basically a child, then. Take care of it.

name: Solo
description: Solo, dewana-wanga!

name: Six
description: Is it true in Germany they pronounce it "sex?"

name: Four to Six
description: Just like the production company behind hit 90's sitcom Dharma & Greg, except without the terrible 90's sitcom Dharma & Greg.

name: 3 to 5 minutes
description: This is definitely complicated, I know. Hey, wait, I'm just a little box of text, what do I know?

name: 5 to 10 minutes
description: This could be a bit long, but I'm sure it's worth it, right?

name: Less than 5 minutes
description: It's hard to say, really, but this certainly won't take longer than five minutes.

name: Less than 3 Minutes
description: This is short and sweet. It might not actually be that sweet, because I don't know everything, but I do know that it's short.

name: 5 Minutes
description: You can almost set you watch to this game, which may or may not actually be a part of it.

name: Thirty minutes or more
description: This is a long game, probably enough to be the entire content of a show.

name: Long Form
description: This is a Long Form style game, which means it will be, well, long. We're talking 20 to 40 minutes, depending on how good you are at editing scenes.

name: n/a
description: This is either a modifier of other games or some sort of conceptual thing that doesn't really involve a duration. This probably wasn't terribly helpful, but you're still reading it anyway.
